value.name: Exhibit explores 'the national emergency of Black grief'
value.description: Nigerian curator and art critic Okwui Enwezor's exhibit “Grief and Grievance: Art and Mourning in America” is on view at New York's New Museum until June 6.

value.name: Quincy woman arrested for child porn
value.description: A Quincy woman has been arrested for Reproduction of Child Pornography and Possession of Child Pornography, according to Quincy Police.

value.name: Social media helps law enforcement in child pornography case
value.description: Police said social media platforms are helping local police departments track down and arrest suspects in child pornography cases, many times before they get into further activity.

value.name: Black Land Ownership Primed Greenwood’s Rebound After Massacre
value.description: Property owners in Tulsa’s Greenwood district were able to raise money by leveraging the land beneath the rubble, seeding a local economy of Black-owned businesses for the next decades, a WSJ analysis showed.

value.name: Auditors find falsified documents, policies ignored, in Montana PSC review
value.description: Citing falsified documentation and lax spending practices at the Montana Public Service Commission, state legislative auditors say there isn’t enough credible information to assess the department’s finances.

value.description: ATL rap veteran OG KV, CEO of Big Play Entertainment, delivers new music for the streets in the form of a new single “Down” that will be featured on his accompanying project OG Music.  The song “Down” tackles the issues of police brutality and all that goes into the police using their badge to do anything and everything but protect and serve

value.name: Lexington council adds money to budget to help people file police complaints
value.description: The Lexington council added money Thursday for a new road next to an elementary school, expanded a position to help people file complaints against police and set aside $150,000 for a redesign of Phoenix Park as part of changes to Mayor Linda Gorton’s proposed $398 million spending plan.

value.name: BrewDog bar in York reopens after car crashes through window
value.description: A BAR in York has now reopened after a driver crashed a car through the front window yesterday - which caused no structural damage to the building.

value.name: An Exhibition at the New Museum Reflects a Year—and Many Years—of Grief
value.description: It’s not very often that you visit a museum exhibition and see your feelings precisely on display. As a Black woman whose work and writing sit at the intersection of grief and racism, I have always felt a deep sense of responsibility to acknowledge Black grief.
